poem:
"Still Moment in Station Static"

In the murmurs of morning news,
small graters from Japan whir -
Trioli leaves airwaves for a dancer's shoes,
the soft rustle of laurels procured.

A six-part series of artistic minds,
painted in the space where sound should be.
The humble, the intricate - she finds,
In the fleeting melody of ABC.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Three things with Virginia Trioli: ‘I have several small graters from Japan, each for a certain foodstuff’ In 2023, after four years hosting ABC Radio Melbourne’s morning program, Virginia Trioli announced she was leaving the airwaves to front a TV arts show with the national broadcaster. In April, the journalist and broadcaster will host Creative Types with Virginia Trioli, a six-part series with some of Australia’s great artistic minds. Each episode will see Trioli meet". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
